column2: It appears  that  the  Appellant had  misdirected  himself  with certain
items of evidence when he relied on these considerations. The prosecution

column1: never  presented  its  case  on the  basis  of  the  Appellant had  fired  the  T 56
rifle with a fully loaded magazine attached to  it.  Therefore,  the number of
spent bullets  has  no  significance  on  the  evidence  of  the  prosecution.  The
evidence  of  7  to  8  shots  being  fired  was  led  in  relation  to

during  which  the  1st  deceased  received  fatal 
injuries.
